conclusion: Analyze the flow of liquid from A, B, C, and D through baffles to containers E, F, or G.
Image shows a Plinko-like setup with colored liquid sources at the top, baffles in the middle, and containers at the bottom.
Trace the path of each liquid from its source through the baffles to the containers.
Liquid sources: A (blue), B (yellow), C (green), D (orange).
Baffles are angled and colored but colors don't affect flow.
Containers: E (yellow), F (brown), G (blue).
Liquids are shown mid-flow, indicating their paths.
Liquid A (blue) starts from the leftmost opening.
Blue liquid flows along a blue baffle angled downward to the right.
Blue liquid drips off the right end of the blue baffle.
Below the blue baffle is a brown baffle angled downward to the left.
Blue liquid falls onto the brown baffle near its right end and slides leftward.
Blue liquid reaches the left end of the brown baffle.
From the left end of the brown baffle, blue liquid falls straight down into container E.
Liquid A will flow into container E.
Liquid B (yellow) starts from the second opening from the left.
Yellow liquid flows along the same blue baffle as A.
Yellow liquid drips off the right end of the blue baffle.
Yellow liquid falls onto the brown baffle, landing closer to the middle.
Yellow liquid slides leftward on the brown baffle.
Yellow liquid reaches the left end of the brown baffle.
From the left end of the brown baffle, yellow liquid falls straight down into container E.
Liquid B will also flow into container E.
Liquid C (green) starts from the third opening from the left.
